item.title: About
item.description: I am a PhD Student under the COMPASS CDT in the Institute for Statistical Science, University of Bristol. Prior to my PhD I completed an integrated master’s degree in Mathematics with Statistics at the University of Bristol. My research interests include: Bayesian methods, High-dimensional statistics, Computational statistics, Graph theory. You can contact me at jake.spiteri@bristol.ac.uk..

item.title: Portfolio
item.description: I am currently in the first year of my PhD which involves a year of training. I have built up a portfolio of code and notes during this year which are available below. Notes and reports Statistical Methods 1 — Lecture Notes. Statistical Computing 1 — Reports which can be found below. An introduction to R Reproducibility Projects, version control, and packages Vectorization and parallel computing Functional and object-oriented programming Tidyverse Debugging and performance Matrices Numerical optimization (extended report) Integration and Markov chain Monte Carlo (extended report) Presentations Optimization and the BFGS Algorithm [December 2019] — slides here.
